content: The Profane Fire of Nadab and Abihu
Then Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, each took his censer and put fire in it, put incense on it, and offered profane fire before the , which He had not commanded them.
So fire went out from the  and devoured them, and they died before the .
And Moses said to Aaron, “This is what the  spoke, saying:So Aaron held his peace.
Then Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said to them, “Come near, carry your brethren from before the sanctuary out of the camp.”
So they went near and carried them by their tunics out of the camp, as Moses had said.

And Moses said to Aaron, and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his sons, “Do not uncover your heads nor tear your clothes, lest you die, and wrath come upon all the people. But let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the  has kindled.
You shall not go out from the door of the tabernacle of meeting, lest you die, for the anointing oil of the   upon you.” And they did according to the word of Moses.
Conduct Prescribed for Priests
Then the  spoke to Aaron, saying:
“Do not drink wine or intoxicating drink, you, nor your sons with you, when you go into the tabernacle of meeting, lest you die.  a statute forever throughout your generations,
that you may distinguish between holy and unholy, and between unclean and clean,
and that you may teach the children of Israel all the statutes which the  has spoken to them by the hand of Moses.”

And Moses spoke to Aaron, and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his sons who were left: “Take the grain offering that remains of the offerings made by fire to the , and eat it without leaven beside the altar; for it  most holy.
You shall eat it in a holy place, because it  your due and your sons’ due, of the sacrifices made by fire to the ; for so I have been commanded.

The breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the heave offering you shall eat in a clean place, you, your sons, and your daughters with you; for  your due and your sons’ due,  are given from the sacrifices of peace offerings of the children of Israel.

The thigh of the heave offering and the breast of the wave offering they shall bring with the offerings of fat made by fire, to offer  a wave offering before the . And it shall be yours and your sons’ with you, by a statute forever, as the  has commanded.”
Then Moses made careful inquiry about the goat of the sin offering, and there it was—burned up. And he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron  left, saying,
“Why have you not eaten the sin offering in a holy place, since it  most holy, and  has given it to you to bear the guilt of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the ?
See! Its blood was not brought inside the holy  indeed you should have eaten it in a holy  as I commanded.”

And Aaron said to Moses, “Look, this day they have offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before the , and such things have befallen me!  I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been accepted in the sight of the ?”
